Contact Us


Share Your News
We encourage alumni and Wildcats on campus to let us know about your achievements.
Send us an Email

For the Media
Looking for expert commentary on a certain field or current event? Visit our Faculty Expert Database to find a source.
For additional assistance with sourcing or questions about the University, please contact Sean Murphy, Media Relations Coordinator, at 530-898-6492 or samurphy@csuchico.edu.

Contact University Communications
University Communications is dedicated to telling Chico State story through a variety of mediums including print publications, enewsletters, websites, and social media.
Meet our Team
Our Office
Kendall Hall, Room 115530–898-4143ucomm@csuchico.edu
Mailing Address
University Communications400 W. First StreetChico, CA 95929–0040

To reach other areas on campus or for Admissions information, visit our website www.csuchico.edu.


Submit a Tip



Trinity Hall Carillon is seen as blossoms shine in the Spring weather on campus on Friday, March 25, 2016 in Chico, Calif. 
(Jason Halley/University Photographer)

It is CSU, Chico policy to make all information accessible to students, faculty, staff, and the general public. University Communications is committed to making the Chico State Today website meet WCAG 2.0 AA accessibility standards and is actively working to remediate issues. We encourage users who encounter inaccessible content to use the “Report an accessibility issue” link in the site footer. We are committed to resolving reported issues as soon as possible.









						We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, the Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus.
					

						We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.
